bibl.title: Letter from Mary A. Benjamin to Philip Showalter Hench, March 24, 1948

div1.p: Benjamin tells Hench that the New York Academy of Medicine has taken possession of the correspondence relating to Curie's visit to the United States.

div1.head: Letter from Mary A. Benjamin to Philip Showalter Hench, March 24, 1948
div1.opener:
Walter R Benjamin
Autographs
Established 1887
I EAST 57th STREET
NEW YORK 22, NEW YORK
March 24, 1948
MARY A. BENJAMIN, Director
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
The New York Academy of Medicine came yesterday to get the
small bunch of items relating to Madame Curie's visit to this
country. I told them that you did not want them back and that
they could use them as they saw fit. I made it quite clear to
them that the correspondence was a gift from you.
div1.closer:
Faithfully yours, Mary A. Benjamin MAB:md
